meanings.def: to move or act quickly because there is not much time
examples: You'll have to hurry if you want to catch that train.
We need to hurry or we'll be late for school.
hurry to do something The kids hurried to open their presents.

meanings.def: to move quickly in a particular direction
examples: He picked up his bags and hurried across the courtyard.
She hurried away without saying goodbye.
She hurried after Gary to apologize to him.
She hurried down the street.
I hurried home to tell him the news.
Ben hurried after her.
She came hurrying over to greet them.
She hurried along the corridor.
We nodded at her and hurried out the door.
He hurried over to the window to see what the noise was.
Kathy hurried off in the same direction.

meanings.def: to make somebody do something more quickly
examples: hurry somebody I don't want to hurry you but we close in twenty minutes.
hurry somebody into doing something She was hurried into making an unwise choice.
Her application was hurried through.
be hurried A good meal should never be hurried.

related: in a hurry to do something
not in a/any hurry (to do something)
somebody will not do something again in a hurry

meanings.def: the need or wish to get something done quickly
examples: Take your time—there's no hurry.
What's the hurry? The train doesn't leave for an hour.
in your hurry to do something In my hurry to leave, I forgot my passport.

meanings.def: very quickly or more quickly than usual
examples: He had to leave in a hurry.

meanings.def: not having enough time to do something
examples: Sorry, I haven't got time to do it now—I'm in a hurry.
Alice was in a tearing hurry as usual.
I was late for work and in a big hurry.
My daughter is in such a hurry to grow up.
Why are you in such a hurry to sell?
They were in a hurry to set off.
I don't mind waiting—I'm not in any particular hurry.
Serve this lady first—I’m in no hurry.

meanings.def: not wanting or not willing to do something
examples: We were in no hurry to get back to work after the holiday.
She's in no hurry to find out how much her phone bill comes to.

meanings.def: used to say that somebody does not want to do something again because it was not pleasant or fun
examples: I won't be going there again in a hurry—the food was terrible.

idioms.def: very quickly or more quickly than usual
examples: He had to leave in a hurry.
Sorry, I haven't got time to do it now—I'm in a hurry.
Alice was in a tearing hurry as usual.
I was late for work and in a big hurry.

idioms.idiom: in a hurry to do something
examples: My daughter is in such a hurry to grow up.
Why are you in such a hurry to sell?
They were in a hurry to set off.

idioms.idiom: in no hurry (to do something) | not in a/any hurry (to do something)
examples: I don't mind waiting—I'm not in any particular hurry.
Serve this lady first—I’m in no hurry.
We were in no hurry to get back to work after the holiday.
She's in no hurry to find out how much her phone bill comes to.

idioms.idiom: somebody will not do something again in a hurry
idioms.def: used to say that somebody does not want to do something again because it was not pleasant or fun
examples: I won't be going there again in a hurry—the food was terrible.
